alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Chattooga; Dade; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 7:33PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catoosa, northwestern Whitfield, Walker, Dade and northwestern Chattooga Counties through 815 PM EST... At 733 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Bridgeport to near Lake Guntersville St Park, and moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Ringgold, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Rossville, Chickamauga, Trion, Lookout Mountain, Menlo, Center Post, Blue Spring, Fairview, Cloudland, Chattanooga Valley, Hooker, Cloudland Canyon State Park, Cooper Heights, Rock Spring, Naomi and Rising Fawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
